subject: Re: [junit] Standalone or "requires environment" information
messageBody:
> I had similar thoughts to David. My motivation was working from home
> when I didn't have access to the database but would still like to
> execute as many tests as possible.

I don't know if this already exists but it could be interesting to develop a
recorder/player wrapper mock object. You can set up the mock object to save
into a file the response it receives via the wrapped object. You can then
reset the mock object to replay (without the wrapped object) from a file. If
this is done automatically, it can really be very handy to test databases.

I don't know if this is obvious but there's a simple way to share a connection
between multiple tests (if you don't have static variables) to speed up your
tests:

public void MyTestCase {

public static Test suite() {
return new TestSetup( new TestSuite(MyTestCase.class) {
private Connection conn;
setUp() {
conn = new Connection(...);
for ( int i = 0; i < suite.countTestCases(); i++ ) {
MyTestCase test = ( MyTestCase ) suite.testAt( i );
test.setConnection(conn);
}
}
tearDown() {
conn.close();
}
};
}

Connection connection;

public void setConnection(Connectio connection) {
this.connection = connection;
}

}

So you don't have to open/close a connection before/after each test.
